ygData.subject: Re: EQ Testing Procedure
ygData.msgSnippet: Harmonic, The problem is that 99.95 percent of the time NO PERSON on test knows what to test. We aren t told the changes most of the time, and if something is
ygData.messageBody:
Harmonic,
The problem is that 99.95 percent of the time NO PERSON on test knows
what to test. We aren't told the changes most of the time, and if something
is broke we dont know what to look for. We dont get a " ok we did this " now
go out and test to see if its stabe, exploitable, if it even works. We are
kept in the dark just as much as the rest of anyone else. And it is
unfortunate. I read a really great article to day over on the xrgaming
network about Asheron's Call's Dev team. Man i really wish that was a better
game...if EQ had AC's dev team we would have an awsome game and a much
better relationship between the customer and the MAN.

--Cethan playing as Jalaric
16th level Bard
TS resident since March

BTW about getting a character buffed to your present level on test? dont
hold your breath...they havent done anything like that since the population
explosion.
----- Original Message -----
From: "Ryan Honeyman" <honeyman@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Thursday, January 06, 2000 4:38 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] EQ Testing Procedure


> > I found the last statement to be very contradicting. Hasn't the bard
> > community, on numerous occasions to no avail, sent Verant extensive test
> > results proving that some of our songs weren't working properly? Wonder
why
> > they are now asking players to send them test results when they seem to
have
> > ignored ours for the most part?
>
> I just need an email address or a contact, and I'm willing to give
> up a few hours a week to test changes on the Test Server with a bard
> comparable to the bard I currently play. I don't know why they
> wouldn't take me up on it, it makes too much sense. I've got a lot
> of research background, and have very analytical approach to things.
> I do question everything and anything for it's validity.
>
> No one before 1903 thought that humans would be flying, the idea
> was well accepted by the world as ridiculous, yet those people
> who questioned the idea made it happen. Even before all that
> a person would be marked a loon if they didn't believe the Sun
> revolved around the Earth. Such is the nature of this bard =)
>
> Harmonic.
>
>
